intro: Dalechampia tenuiramea var. tenuiramea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, characterized by its slender, hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant often thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is sometimes found in wetlands or along stream banks.
